New Records: Corbin Carroll hit a game-winning grand slam with the bases loaded in the bottom of the eighth inning, giving the Arizona Diamondbacks an 8-5 win over the New York Mets.
Key Match Events: Corbin Carroll hit a comebacker in the third inning that stung Luis Severino on the right foot, causing him to limp around the mound.
Corbin Carroll added his first homer of the evening an inning later, a no-doubter to right-center.
Joc Pederson hit a two-run moon shot to right.
Díaz was wild from the start, missing with a first-pitch slider in and three fastballs up and away to pinch hitter Pavin Smith.
Pre-Game Insights: Brandon Nimmo took a positive approach, saying the Mets were still playing good baseball and had opportunities to take three of four from the Padres and the first two of this series against the Diamondbacks.
Post-Match Reflections: Díaz said, “It’s a tough loss. We had it.”
Brandon Nimmo said, “It hurts. Nothing we can do about it now, so we just move forward.”
Luis Severino said, “A lot of pain, I’m not gonna lie. I’ll have a painful next three days, but it’s going to be good.”
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Mets have to showcase that same resilience in the face of present pain.
The math is not kind to them in a National League wild-card race that grows tougher by the day.
The Diamondbacks, San Diego Padres and Atlanta Braves are all on pace for at least 89 wins. New York is four games behind Atlanta and on pace for 84.
